grammars.seekWhence.treeGenUtils

Interface ISwFileReader


  • public interface ISwFileReader
    ISwFileReader allows the generation of a 'syntactic grove' out of a text file, provided it contains lists of paths of syntactic trees generated using the 'SeekWhence' context-free grammar.
    Author:
    Gael Tregouet
    See Also:
    ISyntacticGrove

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISyntacticGrove getSyntacticGrove(java.lang.Object textFile)
      Writing rules to be respected in order to avoid throwing an exception :
      1-The text contains one or more descriptions of syntactic trees generated using the 'SeekWhence' context-free grammar.

    • Method Detail

      • getSyntacticGrove

        ISyntacticGrove getSyntacticGrove(java.lang.Object textFile)
                           throws SwTreeGenException
        Writing rules to be respected in order to avoid throwing an exception :
        1-The text contains one or more descriptions of syntactic trees generated using the 'SeekWhence' context-free grammar.
        2-Every tree description begins with a line containing only the character '/' 3-Descriptions of syntactic trees take the form of the list of spanning paths a tree contains (i.e. paths from the root element of the tree to any of its terminals).
        4-A path is a concatenation of symbols (i.e., strings) from the 'SeekWhence' grammar, separated by the character '/'. New path, new line. No empty line.
        5-The list of paths must be generated using the following pattern :
        a/b/c
        a/b/d
        a/e/f/g/h
        a/e/f/g/i
        a/e/f/j
        where {a} is the start element, {b,e,f,g} are variable elements and {c,d,h,i,j} are terminals.
        Parameters:
        textFile - is a text file that must respect the rules described above.
        Returns:
        a 'syntactic grove', i.e. a list of syntactic trees with some more functionalities.
        Throws:
        SwTreeGenException
